required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Watch Atrial Fibrillation (AF) Detection Investigation
clinical_study.official_title: Study Watch Atrial Fibrillation (AF) Detection Investigation

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, non-randomized study to refine the Study Watch's algorithm for AF detection within both persistent and paroxysmal AF subjects. The study will also collect data from an FDA-cleared wearable ECG sensor.

primary_outcome.measure: Estimate of the accuracy of algorithm based PPG irregular rhythm detection in a study population with a history of paroxysmal or persistent atrial fibrillation (AF)
primary_outcome.description: Sensitivity estimate for PPG irregular rhythm detection vs. a multi-lead Holter ECG rhythm

primary_outcome.measure: PPG- and ECG-based continuous AF-detection algorithms on Study Watch in a free-living (home) setting by comparing the Study Watch data with an FDA-cleared wearable ECG sensor data.
primary_outcome.description: Number of AF events identified from FDA-cleared ECG Device

secondary_outcome.measure: Estimate of the accuracy of algorithm based PPG irregular rhythm detection in a study population with a history of paroxysmal or persistent atrial fibrillation (AF)
secondary_outcome.description: Predictive value estimate for PPG irregular rhythm detection vs. a multi-lead Holter ECG rhythm

secondary_outcome.measure: Spontaneously-reported participant usability feedback for Study Watch and its ECG feature in a free-living (home) setting with the target AF population.

intervention.description: Study Watch is a miniaturized physiological data monitoring and data collection device for continuous recording of physiological and environmental data

study_pop.textblock: Subjects with a known history of AF (including persistent or paroxysmal AF)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- At least 18 years old
- Able to read and speak English
- Able and willing to sign written Informed Consent
- Interest in participating in the study
- Subjects with a known history of AF (including persistent or paroxysmal AF)
- Without significant limitation in ability to participate in the study, in the opinion of the investigator.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Currently in a paced rhythm
- Known severe allergy to nickel or metal jewelry
- Known allergic reaction to adhesives or hydrogels or with family history of adhesive skin allergies
